article.description: Tristan Thompson scored 23 points, Josh White added 21 and North Texas erased a 14-point deficit in the second half in an 81-77 victory against Texas State on Saturday.
article.headline: North Texas rallies from 14 down, tips Texas St.
article.linkText: North Texas rallies from 14 down, tips Texas St.
article.story: SAN MARCOS, Texas -- Tristan Thompson scored 23 points, Josh White added 21 and North Texas erased a 14-point deficit in the second half in an 81-77 victory against Texas State on Saturday. The Mean Green (4-1) outscored Texas State 28-12 in the final 5:12. Ryan White scored 16 points and Tony Bishop and John Bowman 12 apiece for the Bobcats (2-3). Thompson and White buried two 3-pointers each in just over a minute as North Texas turned a 67-56 deficit into a lead it never relinquished. During the second half, the Mean Green shot 69.6 percent (16 for 23) from the floor and held Texas State without a field goal for a late 4 1/2-minute stretch. White helped cement the win by making all six of his free-throw attempts in the last 1:41.

statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
